授業目的: This research seminar will build on the academic inquiries begun in Research I for writing and completing the graduation thesis.
到達目標: Learning goals for students include: 1. Gain confidence in your reading, writing, and presentation skills; 2. Collect and analyze survey data; 3. Write and complete a graduation thesis; 4. Present findings: executive summary, poster, and presentations.
関連科目: Completed Research Seminar I. Courses related to Climate Justice and/or Intercultural relations and minority issues (these courses can be taken con-currently). Student’s curiosity and interest in climate change, population health, just transition, international relations, intercultural relations and minority issues, and/or Christianity and social justice welcomed.
授業方法: Consultative learning tailored to individual student learning goals, timelines, and writing.

トピック.授業計画1:
Co-designed with students enabling progression throughout the year with a flow as follows:

April-May: Any data collection and beginnings of analyses

June-July: Writing! Presentations. 

September-October: Writing, edits, and refining! Poster and possible presentations.

November-December: More writing and edits, and completion of graduation thesis! Executive summary and presentations.
トピック.授業外学習2: The completion of the graduation thesis is our shared goal. Students are expected to take initiative, engage with the chosen topic, take leadership in researching and writing.                 In-class sessions may become less regular as more writing time is needed.                             Also, time and effort will be taken to prepare for poster and presentations to share research progress and findings with other students.

評価.学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Feedback at mid-term and year's end.
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
This course satisfies "Skills of Understanding and analyzing international affairs," "Skills of finding and solving problems," "Intercultural understanding skills and multicultural adaptability" and "Ethical values"　of the Diploma Policies.
